巴卡點會剩係岩踢企定定既波，佢上前逼同後搶係一流，講到尾根本馬田尼唔鐘意巴卡姐，要買上季買左啦。未撚見過一個踢得咁好既球員，係會唔買。
泰拉拔係咁，呢次巴卡又係咁，好撚野米蘭

（爆咗post覆返巴打先）
上面師兄應該講果陣個打法企定定打，唔係指巴卡企定定踢
驚巴卡唔啱打而家呢個快陣（我自己就唔擔心）
巴卡果陣最勁係米蘭攻緊時失咗波
對面傳比中圈嘅前鋒，個波未傳到巴卡已經食晒位
一個完美嘅屏障，唔驚輸反擊
又高大腳又長，落腳好準
後上逼搶真係世界級
加上有一定腳法比人夾都唔驚
泰拉拔我當係上個勢代嘅事
佢真係好可惜，明明博晒命終於打到第二春
阿古蘭尼就24.5用到盡，仲同球員講明唔會再出佢
保贊就上季打得好，結果想捧親生仔無腦尼安上位而雪佢
個個都慘變condom

AC Milan have won the race to sign defender Ozan Kabak from Schalke with an announcement expected soon, according to a report.

According to Haber365 – an outlet based in Kabak’s home cou try of Turkey – the Rossoneri have beaten competition from Liverpool and Inter to land the 20-year-old centre-back.


The entourage of the Turkey international left Italy and returned to the city of Gelsenkirchen after reaching an agreement over personal terms, and now the signatures are expected soon with only ‘minor bumps’ standing between Milan and a total agreement.

The former Stuttgart star will join up with compatriot Hakan Çalhanoğlu at San Siro, while the report even adds that a statement is planned for later on Sunday which will officially confirm Kabak’s departure from Schalke.

It is good news for Milan if true as they desperately needed defensive reinforcement given that Alessio Romagnoli, Mateo Musacchio and Leo Duarte are all currently out.
According to Di Marzio‘s latest for Sky Italia, Milan are now trying to sign Rudiger on loan from Chelsea, a player not considered part of Frank Lampard’s plans for the 2020-21 season.

Lille midfielder Boubakary Soumaré has refused an offer from Napoli and decided not to explore the idea of joining Inter, according to a report from French media outlet L’Equipe earlier today.The report details how the 21-year-old French midfielder received offers from both Napoli and Inter on Friday, but has decided not to join either club.
PROMOTED CONTENTMgid

The player is currently in advanced negotiations with fellow Italian side AC Milan, but now seems more likely to stay with Lille where he hopes to win a trophy and look to join a big club next summer.Contracted to Lille until 2022, Soumaré made 30 appearances across all competitions last season for the French side, for a total of 2082 minutes. In that time, he provided one assist and helped the side keep six clean sheets.Inter are now working on selling Radja Nainggolan to Cagliari and potentially looking to sign Marcos Alonso on loan from Chelsea should the Blues open up to the idea.

A legal battle is in the offing after the local health authority confirmed it asked Napoli not to travel to Turin for the Serie A game with Juventus.

The Lega Serie A released a statement this afternoon insisting Napoli had not been able to definitively prove their inability to play tonight’s match.

In that sense, the protocol also used by UEFA remains intact, so if the Partenopei could’ve attended with 13 players including at least one goalkeeper, the game could’ve gone ahead.

Only Piotr Zielinski and Eljif Elmas tested positive within the Napoli squad.

Juve will therefore take to the field tonight with the referees and, after 45 minutes, can leave with Napoli later forfeiting the match 3-0.

However, the ASL (local health authority) in Naples has released another statement following ‘requests for clarification.’

This makes absolutely clear that “there were not the necessary conditions to allow for travel in full safety” because they would’ve had to fly to Turin and therefore come into contact with airport workers, passengers in the hotel, etc.

Napoli have been locked into a ‘fiduciary isolation’ in their Castelvolturno training ground while more tests are taken, because COVID-19 has a long incubation period.

Technically, the Lega Serie A protocol does allow for local health authorities or Government to over-ride their rules if travel is banned.

Napoli hope to make their case via lawyers when this goes to the Disciplinary Commission.

Until that point, as things stand, we won’t know if the game is merely postponed or if Napoli forfeit it 3-0.

The only official statement made by Napoli since Elmas tested positive last night was to deny reports coach Gennaro Gattuso had tested positive.
